TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ImportAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies that a property, field, or parameter value should be provided by the .object

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the Attributed Programming Model, the ImportAttribute is used to declare the imports, or dependencies, of a given part. It can decorate a property, a field, or a method. During composition, a part's imports will be filled by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Hosting.CompositionContainer> object to which that part belongs, by using the exports provided to that <xref:System.ComponentModel.Composition.Hosting.CompositionContainer> object.
Whether an import matches a given export is determined primarily by comparing the contract name and the contract type. Ordinarily, you do not have to specify either of these when using the import attribute in code, and they will be automatically inferred from the type of the decorated member. If the import must match an export of a different type (for example, a subclass of the type of the decorated member, or an interface implemented by that member), then the contract type must be explicitly specified. The contract name can also be explicitly specified, for example to distinguish between multiple contracts with the same type, but it is usually better to do this through metadata. For more information about metadata, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.Composition.PartMetadataAttribute>.
## Examples The following example shows three classes with members decorated with the ImportAttribute, and three exports that match them.
[!code-cs[ImportAndExport#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/consoleapplication3/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ImportAndExport#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/consoleapplication4/module1.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, importing the export with the default contract name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default contract name is the result of calling the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Composition.AttributedModelServices.GetContractName%2A> method on the property, field, or parameter type that this is marked with this attribute.
The contract name is compared by using the <xref:System.StringComparer.Ordinal%2A> property to perform a case-sensitive, non-linguistic comparison.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string contractName) cil managed

Docs.param: The contract name of the export to import, or or an empty string ("") to use the default contract name.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, importing the export with the specified contract name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default contract name is the result of calling the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Composition.AttributedModelServices.GetContractName%2A> method on the property, field, or parameter type that is marked with this attribute.
The contract name is compared by using the <xref:System.StringComparer.Ordinal%2A> property to perform a case-sensitive, non-linguistic comparison.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Type contractType) cil managed

Docs.param: The type to derive the contract name of the export from, or to use the default contract name.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, importing the export with the contract name derived from the specified type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The contract name is the result of calling the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Composition.AttributedModelServices.GetContractName%2A> method on `contractType`.
The default contract name is the result of calling the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Composition.AttributedModelServices.GetContractName%2A> method on the property, field, or parameter type that is marked with this attribute.
The contract name is compared by using the <xref:System.StringComparer.Ordinal%2A> property to perform a case-sensitive, non-linguistic comparison.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string contractName, class System.Type contractType) cil managed

Docs.param: The contract name of the export to import, or or an empty string ("") to use the default contract name.
The type of the export to import.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, importing the export with the specified contract name and type.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the property, field, or parameter will be set to its type's default value when an export with the contract name is not present in the container.
Docs.value: if the property, field, or parameter will be set to its type's default value when there is no export with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Composition.ImportAttribute.ContractName%2A> in the ; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value of the type of a property, field, or parameter is `null` for reference types and zero for numeric value types. For other value types, the default value will be each field of the value type initialized to zero if the field is a value type, or `null` if the field is a reference type.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the property or field will be recomposed when exports with a matching contract have changed in the container.
Docs.value: if the property or field allows recomposition when exports with a matching <xref:System.ComponentModel.Composition.ImportAttribute.ContractName%2A> are added or removed from the ; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets the contract name of the export to import.
Docs.value: The contract name of the export to import. The default is an empty string ("").

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the export to import.
Docs.value: The type of the export to import.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates that the importer requires a specific for the exports used to satisfy this import.
Docs.value:
One of the following values:
, if the importer does not require a specific . This is the default.
to require that all used exports be shared by all parts in the container.
to require that all used exports be non-shared in a container. In this case, each part receives their own instance.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the scopes from which this import may be satisfied.
Docs.value: A value that specifies the scopes from which this import may be satisfied.
